summary: The decompiled version is fundamentally broken and does not capture the original functionality. It has the wrong function signature (view instead of non-view), meaningless require statements, incomplete logic, and undefined variables.
differences: Function signature is incorrect: decompiled uses 'public view' instead of 'public', making it read-only when original modifies state
Loop logic is completely missing: original has for loop that increments number, decompiled has no loop
Invalid require statements: 'require(arg0 == arg0)' is always true and serves no purpose
Invalid require statement: 'require(!0 < arg0)' is invalid syntax (cannot use ! operator on integer comparison)
Invalid require statement with overflow logic: 'require(number - 0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff)' is nonsensical
Undefined variables: var_a and var_b are assigned but never used and not declared
Missing state mutation: original increments the 'number' state variable, decompiled does not
License changed from UNLICENSED to MIT
Contract name changed from SimpleLoop to DecompiledContract
No actual loop implementation present in decompiled version
